item.title: Young people urged to join stem cell donor roll with full matches hard to come by
item.description: Rowan Tong-Law, 18, was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukaemia last year and has been searching for a full stem cell donor match.

item.title: Woman's two-year journey advocating for Auslan support highlights cracks in aged care system
item.description: One Deaf woman living with dementia has been without basic care services for two years. Advocates warn her story represents a much larger problem.

item.title: Coronial inquest investigates Terry Airey's death at Sunshine Coast University Hospital
item.description: A Queensland hospital has increased staffing and revamped its radiology protocols and systems following an 87-year-old's death from organ failure after routine surgery.

item.title: Life on the APY Lands where family, country and culture are protected
item.description: The stark beauty of Australia's protected APY Lands is alive with ancient songlines and culture. But Elders see a need for change to secure the future of today's children.

item.title: Frank Gehry, world-renowned architect who designed the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao, dies aged 96
item.description: Gehry's most memorable creations were either celebrated as works of genius or reviled as self-indulgent messes — but either way, people were looking, as he liked to say.

item.title: Blue whale calf numbers rise after slow migration start along WA's south west coast
item.description: Researchers are relieved as baby blue whale numbers increase after a slow start to the migration season.

item.title: Blue whale swimming off Busselton Jetty
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Blue whales off Dunsborough
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: This tasty, veggie-filled omlette is a fast and satisfying meal - ABC News
item.description: Ejjeh is a traditional omelette made with eggs, herbs, spices and that soft zucchini flesh that would otherwise go to waste. It's simple, fresh and full of flavour.

item.title: Asbestos found in new Edith Cowan University campus in Perth CBD
item.description: WA's parliament is told asbestos has been discovered in fire doors at Edith Cowan University's flagship new campus in Perth's CBD, and it won't be removed until after the first semester next year.

item.title: The National Indigenous Art Triennial in Canberra reflects on legacy, rebirth and renewal
item.description: Indigenous artists from across Australia, including Alair Pambegan and Grace Kemarre Robinya, feature as part of the National Indigenous Art Triennial in Canberra: After the Rain.

item.title: Bunbury Indigenous elders write children's book in Noongar language to preserve culture
item.description: Once forbidden from speaking their local language, a group of Indigenous elders in WA use it in a children's book, hoping to breathe life into a dying dialect.

item.title: Interest rate hikes increasingly likely in 2026 but a major event would produce the opposite result
item.description: Inflation is a problem as 2025 comes to a close and it's set to remain that way. Without a swift rise in productivity or a financial markets meltdown, borrowers are facing several interest rate hikes next year.

item.title: Controversial genetically modified mosquito release paused after backlash in Qld
item.description: An organisation that planned to sell "friendly" mosquitoes to reduce the spread of diseases like dengue withdraws its licence application after backlash from scientists and health experts.

item.title: Malaysian football in chaos after FIFA suspends national players from Argentina, Spain and Brazil
item.description: A football players' union says seven South American and European members of the Malaysian national team suspended over allegedly forged documents are "victims".

item.title: Socceroos far from a World Cup 'group of death' against United States, Paraguay and a European qualifier
item.description: Nothing can be guaranteed in a World Cup, but the Socceroos' draw alongside the United States, Paraguay and a European qualifier gives a solid shot at advancing, with the Australians avoiding most of the big names.

item.title: 2025 US National Security Strategy warns Europe faces 'civilisational erasure', does not mention AUKUS
item.description: The Trump administration releases a document saying its goal is to "help Europe correct its current trajectory", adding that it faces "civilisational erasure" due in part to "mass migration".

item.title: Whale researchers in Timor-Leste are calling for regulation of the whale watching industry following reports of operators piloting boats too close to mammals.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The gold toilet, the bags of cash and the corruption still stalking Ukraine
item.description: Ukraine has a history of corruption issues, but the latest allegations include close confidants of the president and many people want answers from Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

item.title: Critics choice nominations 2026: Sinners scores 17 nods, One Battle After Another earns 14
item.description: The gothic vampire period drama Sinners has topped the Critics' Choice Movie Awards, securing 17 nods, followed by One Battle After Another with 14.

item.title: Teen seriously injured in e-bike crash in Claremont after e-rideables inquiry called for widespread changes
item.description: A 14-year-old boy suffers serious injuries in an e-bike crash in Perth's western suburbs, just two days after a parliamentary inquiry into WA's e-rideable laws made 33 recommendations in a bid to make the devices safer.

item.title: Not all babies need a hepatitis B shot at birth, US vaccine advisers say
item.description: President Donald Trump is calling the vote a "very good decision" after US vaccine advisers recommended ending the universal hepatitis B shots at birth.

item.title: Overnight fire exchange at Afghan-Pakistan border kills five and wounds eight, officials say
item.description: Each side has blamed the other for triggering the clash in violation of a tenuous two-month ceasefire, with the clashes lasting until dawn Saturday.

item.title: Opposition to social media ban scores minor political points at best
item.description: Australia's social media age ban is one of the most significant attempts to rebalance the asymmetric power relationship between government and tech.

item.title: Politicians in South-East Asia ignore climate change at their own political peril
item.description: Accused of incompetence and apathy in the aftermath of natural disasters, governments across Asia are facing increasing backlash as the impact of global warming intensifies.

item.title: How pregnancy is being criminalised in post-Roe America
item.description: In the wake of widespread abortion bans, US prosecutors launch hundreds of cases charging people with crimes related to their pregnancy, miscarriage, stillbirth or birth.

item.title: Hard Quiz: So, you think you're good at quizzes? It's time to play HARD!
item.description: Alright, show us what you've got. I'll keep my expectations low.

item.title: Gearing up for the school holidays? Here's how to survive them without social media
item.description: These school holidays, children under 16 will find themselves with less social media access as a ban comes into place. We asked the experts how parents can best support their kids with the transition.

item.title: What life's like when you're Deaf and blind
item.description: Living with vision impairment throws up many challenges. Being Deaf on top of that requires you to go to even greater lengths just to fit in with the modern world. This is how one Deafblind woman does it.

item.title: Rare piece of Australia's Indigenous history captured on camera in the desert
item.description: In the 1960s, the last of the desert families were coming into contact with white people. For one woman, the moment was captured on camera.

item.title: Russia's claim it has captured key Ukrainian city could be Putin 'scaremongering'
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin this week claimed Moscow's biggest battlefield gain in close to two years: the Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk. Some experts don't believe him.

item.title: Republicans just won an election in Tennessee but it's still bad news for Trump
item.description: A Republican claimed a win at a by-election in Tennessee this week, but his party colleagues are sounding alarm bells.

item.title: Australia senses Ashes kill as England and Bazball face day of reckoning at the Gabba
item.description: Australia was patient, mature and ruthless on day three at the Gabba, widening the chasm between it and an England side now set for its day of reckoning.

item.title: Reedy Creek Reserve's Paperbark Forest Walk in Agnes Water closed after tourist and environment concerns
item.description: Bush Heritage Australia says it is still considering how to safely reopen the walk, which prior to closure was being visited by 100,000 people a year.

item.title: Melbourne council responds to lunch-thieving seagulls knocking food from pedestrians' hands
item.description: Pesky seagulls snatching food from unsuspecting members of the public has spurred a Melbourne council to start canine patrols of Federation Square.

item.title: 'Less algal influence' seen in some SA waters, divers say
item.description: Open water divers say underwater visibility has improved and marine life is returning to some areas off South Australia's coast. Experts say it's a positive sign, but warn it's "way too early" to say the environment is recovering from the state's algal bloom.

item.title: Criminals are trying new methods to get drugs into Australia but authorities say they are always watching
item.description: The alleged use of an international livestock ship to smuggle drugs into Western Australia last month prompted a media storm, but one expert says it is just one among a "dizzying variety" of methods criminals are trying.

item.title: Water leaks, electric shocks force 32yo breast cancer unit off road in Tasmania
item.description: Tasmania's health department was aware a 32-year-old breast cancer screening bus was unsafe for years, but continued operating it up until two staff suffered electric shocks.

item.title: Insurance doctor never spoke to traumatised former NSW Police officer before challenging his mental health
item.description: A former NSW Police officer with post-traumatic stress disorder had his mental health incorrectly challenged by a doctor who never consulted or examined him during a year-long battle with the force's insurer.

item.title: Aged care in Australia under the microscope in new documentary Careless
item.description: Filmmaker Sue Thomson recently lost her mum. But before that, they made the beautiful documentary Careless together, which explores Australia's aged care system mess.

item.title: Western Australia's Port Hedland marks 50th anniversary of Cyclone Joan
item.description: Cyclone Joan made landfall near the WA mining town of Port Hedland a year after Cyclone Tracy flattened Darwin, and it was almost as powerful.

item.title: Russian drone, missile attacks target Ukrainian railways and power infrastructure in overnight barrage
item.description: A large-scale Russian drone and missile attack damages power facilities in eight Ukrainian regions, causing blackouts and forcing nuclear power plants to cut output.

item.title: Researchers are teaching foxes not to eat freshwater turtle eggs, by making them feel sick
item.description: Researchers in Victoria are using taste aversion conditioning to stop foxes eating native turtle eggs.

item.title: Socceroos FIFA World Cup 2026 times, dates and locations set, with games in Vancouver, Seattle and Santa Clara
item.description: Australia's North American west coast adventure at the World Cup is confirmed, with matches in Vancouver, Seattle and Santa Clara in California.

item.title: Australia's new land clearing, regrowth laws spark concern among farmers
item.description: Queensland producers say a blanket approach to environmental laws will restrict their ability to manage land sustainably and responsibly.

item.title: Prime minister's office approved Anika Wells's almost-$100,000 flights
item.description: The furore over Communications Minister Anika Wells's expenses continues, with just three days until the government's much-anticipated social media ban for under 16s comes into force.

item.title: Iconic Lagoon restaurant lease ends after 40 colourful and controversial years
item.description: For four decades Lagoon Restaurant has been one of Wollongong's most iconic and controversial establishments, enjoying a prime seaside location and a close relationship with the city's political class.

item.title: Surf Life Saving WA brings all-abilities nippers program to regions for the first time
item.description: Catering to children with autism spectrum disorders, it is the first of its kind in regional Western Australia.

item.title: Cleveland Dodd inquest findings expected to unpack dysfunction in WA's youth justice system
item.description: The coroner investigating WA’s first recorded death in youth detention is expected to hand down wide-ranging findings and recommendations following the death of 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd in 2022. Here's everything you need to know.

item.title: Four arrested after food thrown at Crown Jewels display case
item.description: An organisation called Take Back Power, which describes itself as a civil resistance group, posted footage of the incident on social media and said two of its members had smothered the Imperial State Crown display case with apple crumble and custard.

item.title: The $108 billion Warner Bros and Netflix deal has sparked backlash — here's why
item.description: A major deal between Netflix and Warner Bros has sent shock waves through Hollywood and sparked backlash.

item.title: Unpause and rewind: Cassette tapes are making a comeback
item.description: For a supposedly obsolete music format, audio cassette sales seem to be set on fast forward at the moment.

item.title: South Australian distillers tap into trending thirst for limoncello
item.description: South Australian distillers are tapping into a growing global thirst for limoncello and finding a new market for lemons and grape spirit.

item.title: Tasmania Fire Service confirms 19 homes destroyed and nearly 200 assets damaged in Dolphin Sands bushfire
item.description: The Tasmania Fire Service confirms 19 homes have been claimed by a bushfire that ripped through Dolphin Sands this week, while nearly 200 assets have been damaged.

item.title: Yatala prisoner hospitalised after being 'brutally bashed', union says
item.description: A 20-year-old prisoner was so badly bashed at an Adelaide jail on Sunday morning that he was left "barely recognisable" and had to be rushed to hospital for treatment, a union says.

item.title: Man smashes ambulance windscreen with head in Kalgoorlie-Boulder
item.description: A video circulated on social media shows a naked male using his head to smash the windscreen of a moving ambulance.

item.title: Japan and Australia urge calm after Chinese radar locks onto Japanese jets
item.description: Japan formally protests the incident, calling it "an extremely regrettable" and dangerous act that "exceeded the scope necessary for safe aircraft operations".

item.title: Ben Stokes questions England's ability to handle Ashes pressure as Brendon McCullum warns of 'glass jaw'
item.description: England's famed captain-coach duo aren't going to let their relationship fray in the face of the biggest test of their polarising tenure.

item.title: Is it ever OK to leave a party or social event without saying goodbye?
item.description: We asked two experts for their advice on the etiquette of leaving a social gathering without notice and the best approaches to take if you do need to depart suddenly.

item.title: Australia and Steve Smith chase total Ashes domination as England pokes the bear in Brisbane
item.description: The snarl on Steve Smith's face proves conclusively that Australia doesn't just want to beat the English in this Ashes series. It wants to break them.

item.title: Have you been involved in a multi-level marketing business? Tell us your MLM story
item.description: Multi-level marketing networks have been around for decades. But their business models are changing, with consumer advocates warning that the industry is rife with predatory tactics. We want to hear about your experiences with MLMs.

item.title: Australian MLM influencers are cashing in on the manosphere
item.description: A global multi-level-marketing business that sells expensive water ionisers is shifting its target audience to Aussie tradies, but critics say some of their predatory sales tactics are tantamount to a pyramid scheme.

item.title: Devastated families grapple with ferocity of NSW Central Coast bushfires
item.description: Residents on the NSW coast are coming to terms with property loss after bushfires swept through the region on Saturday.

item.title: Communities harness the people power of co-ops to stave off privatisation
item.description: For its passionate members, saving a historic goldrush-era pub to protect their cooperative was about "economic democracy" and keeping the property out of developers' hands.

item.title: First-home buyers on government's MyHome scheme struggling to get sellers on board
item.description: When Regan buys his first home, the government will own around 30 per cent of it. But he is fast realising that for that to even happen, a lot of things have to fall into place.

item.title: China's global technology and engineering ascendancy continues
item.description: China used to be trying to catch the West, specifically the US. Then it caught up. Now the West is trying to catch up to China, but likely can't.

item.title: Exploitation fears over SA government aged care changes
item.description: The South Australian government is trying to speed up the transfer of hospital patients into aged care, but advocates say they are "trampling on the rights of older people" in the process.

item.title: Anika Wells's taxpayer-funded Thredbo ski trip a costly distraction for Labor
item.description: What was meant to be a Sunday interview bookending a remarkable political year became an exercise in explaining the inexplicable.

item.title: Crops preferred to sheep in large parts of Australia's traditional mixed farming regions
item.description: Mixed farming, which involves growing crops and rearing livestock, used to be standard practice in Australia, but there are almost 100 million fewer sheep in Australia than there were 35 years ago.

item.title: Damaged buildings in Darayya, Syria, one year after the civil war ended
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: A year after the fall of Bashar Al-Assad, Syrians are scraping by
item.description: Today marks one year since the Assad dictatorship in Syria was toppled by Islamist rebels, bringing an end to nearly 14 years of civil war. Some are celebrating, while others continue to struggle.

item.title: Health regulator accused of failing to support patients amid complaints over doctors' conduct
item.description: Two women have told the ABC they believe the health regulator is failing to acknowledge the power imbalance between doctors and patients.

item.title: Where Oscar Piastri lost the Formula 1 world championship, McLaren teammate Lando Norris claims ultimate prize
item.description: Oscar Piastri missed out on winning the Formula 1 drivers world championship by just 13 points to his teammate Lando Norris, the culmination of multiple small moments throughout the season that cost him dearly.

item.title: The US fired on survivors clinging to a 'drug boat' — who gave the order?
item.description: What happened in the lead-up to a second strike on a speedboat in the Caribbean — who knew what and when, and who gave what order — is now under scrutiny.

item.title: Hitchhiking Pilbara mechanic Kevin Guiness recounts a lifetime on the road
item.description: At 12 years old, Kevin Guiness was rebuilding engines on an outback cattle station. Now, after decades travelling the dusty roads in the Pilbara, the Yindjibarndi elder reflects on what kept him going.

item.title: How the internet reacted to Australia winning the second Ashes Test
item.description: Mitchell Starc was the hero, again, as the English were comprehensively outplayed in Brisbane — but how did the internet react?

item.title: Brendon McCullum says England 'over-prepared' ahead of Brisbane Test, as players head to Noosa
item.description: England coach Brendon McCullum claims his team trained too hard for the Gabba Test, which ended in a bruising eight-wicket loss that leaves the tourists' Ashes hopes in tatters.

item.title: Kremlin praises Donald Trump's national security strategy
item.description: The strategy argues the US should revive the 19th century Monroe Doctrine, which declared the Western hemisphere to be Washington's zone of influence.

item.title: Jessica Stenson breaks Australian women's marathon record during Valencia race
item.description: Jessica Stenson breaks the Australian marathon record before an emotional phone call to the former record holder, Sinead Diver.

item.title: How would your feed look if you got to control what you saw on social media?
item.description: Sexual violence prevention group Teach Us Consent is pushing for Australians to have the choice to "opt-in" to social media algorithms.

item.title: Seven South Australian prisons in lockdown as staff hold 24-hour 'stop-work'
item.description: Seven South Australian prisons are in lockdown a day after a prisoner was allegedly assaulted, but the Department for Correctional Services says the industrial action was pre-planned.

item.title: Cleveland Dodd's care in Unit 18 'inhumane', coroner examining youth detention death finds
item.description: Western Australia's first recorded death in youth detention was predictable, a coroner finds, declaring the care of 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd was "inhumane" and "reminiscent of 19th century jails". WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce joins One Nation, concluding defection from Nationals
item.description: Barnaby Joyce's defection gives One Nation its first lower house seat since 1998.

item.title: England's lack of Ashes depth highlighted as Australia A thumps Lions at Allan Border Field
item.description: England's lack of Test depth is highlighted as Australia A beats the Lions by an innings and 127 runs.

item.title: Government will not extend energy bill relief
item.description: Jim Chalmers says the end to the "temporary" subsidy was a "hard" decision but recognises pressures on the budget.

item.title: Thailand launches air strikes amid new border clashes with Cambodia
item.description: Thailand launches air strikes along its disputed border with Cambodia, after both countries accuse one another of breaching a ceasefire agreement brokered by US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Men jailed for gang raping women at Newcastle bucks weekend have convictions quashed
item.description: Marius Hawell, his brother and a friend have had their convictions thrown out on grounds of appeal, after being handed jail sentences of between nine and 14 years.

item.title: One of PNG's rare conjoined twins dies after urgent surgery in Sydney, brother survives
item.description: Surgeons have separated a rare set of conjoined twins after they were urgently flown from Papua New Guinea to Australia, but only one of the boys has survived.

item.title: Queensland government facing fresh legal challenge over controversial puberty blocker ban
item.description: The action is being taken on behalf of the same mother of a transgender teenager who previously successfully fought the state's first ban.

item.title: Coalition puts heat on Wells over trips to cricket and AFL with family
item.description: The Coalition is applying more heat to Sport Minister Anika Wells over flights she claimed for herself and her husband to attend two Boxing Day cricket test matches in recent years, and several AFL Grand Final events.

item.title: Lithium-ion battery suspected to have sparked Caroline Springs house fire
item.description: Fire services are urging people to buy lithium-ion battery products from reputable suppliers ahead of Christmas after yet another house fire was suspected to have been caused by a lithium battery on the weekend.

item.title: Perth man Adam Simon McGovern guilty of making 'upskirt' videos of women, girls
item.description: A man who made 'upskirt' videos of women and girls in public places in Perth is found guilty of multiple charges.

item.title: Australian Ashes openers Travis Head and Jake Weatherald praised as Usman Khawaja call looms
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne says Australia's opening partnership is making the rest of the batting order improve, as selectors deliberate over Usman Khawaja's Test future.

item.title: Should you go screen-free after giving birth? These mums share their stories
item.description: Readers share how they approached their online and social media use in the weeks immediately after giving birth.

item.title: Trump hosts Kennedy Center Honors in historic first
item.description: Donald Trump has made the Kennedy Center a touchstone in a broader attack against what he claims is "woke", anti-American culture.

item.title: Rajwinder Singh found guilty of Toyah Cordingley's 2018 murder on Far North Queensland beach
item.description: It took a jury in the Supreme Court in Cairns seven hours to reach the unanimous guilty verdict after an almost four-week retrial.

item.title: Man accused of raping elderly woman in NSW aged care home gives evidence at his trial
item.description: Hayden Carl Skinner tells the District Court in Coffs Harbour that the open doors of the facility inspired a "spur of the moment" break-in to settle a drug debt.

item.title: More than 30 zinc sunscreen brands using formula that failed preliminary SPF testing
item.description: It's been almost two years since Craig Jones first ran preliminary tests on his zinc sunscreen. When he discovered it wasn't providing the SPF it was supposed to he threw it out and set out on a quest to find out why.

item.title: NRL proposes lengthy bans for Tonga officials following Eli Katoa head knocks
item.description: Three Tonga team officials are facing two-year suspensions following the NRL's investigation into the incident that forced Eli Katoa out of the 2026 season.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Man charged with murder over death of Nikkita Azzopardi found not guilty
item.description: The family of a Melbourne woman who was brutally killed by her partner say they're distraught after the man was found not guilty due to mental impairment.

item.title: Perth boy's death in Department of Communities care may have been accidental, inquest told
item.description: An inquest hears the 2024 death of a 10-year-old Indigenous boy while he was under the care of the Department of Communities may have been an accident, not suicide.

item.title: Clermont's only GP clinic closes after hospital doctor suspended
item.description: The suspension of Tim Lane leaves a Central Queensland town of 3,000 people with no permanent hospital doctor or GP.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce likens One Nation to Reform UK party under Nigel Farage
item.description: In his first interview since formally joining One Nation, Barnaby Joyce says he sees comparisons between his new party and Britain's far-right Reform UK party under populist leader Nigel Farage.

item.title: Renters need $300,000 more superannuation in retirement than home owners, report finds
item.description: Rising rents mean older Australians who are not home owners will need twice as much superannuation to enjoy the same retirement lifestyle as those who are mortgage-free, according to a study by a leading advocacy group.

item.title: Magnitude-7.6 earthquake in Japan prompts tsunami warning and evacuation order for 90,000 people
item.description: The quake has seen a tsunami warning issued for large parts of Japan's northern coastline and about 90,000 people ordered to evacuate to higher ground.

item.title: Jacob Elordi, Rose Byrne and Joel Edgerton score Golden Globes nominations
item.description: Jacob Elordi is Australia's big hope at the Golden Globes after scoring two nominations overnight for the 83rd iteration of the film and television awards.

item.title: Today in History, December 9: How smallpox was eradicated after killing 300 million people in the 20th century
item.description: The eradication of smallpox 46 years ago has been hailed as the greatest triumph of global public health. It has also been held up as a model for global cooperation.

item.title: Australia's favourite political test depends on who is at the pub
item.description: The "pub test" tends to be applied when we've run out of avenues to pursue a public figure, but are still super annoyed.

item.title: For some teenagers, 'life is better' without social media and they support the ban
item.description: Patrick, 15, does not use social media and hopes he never does. Nick, 15, had a flip phone for the first few years of high school. Here is why they support the social media ban.

item.title: Fluke discoveries of asbestos in children's sand strike twice decades apart
item.description: A doctor in the US who found asbestos in his son's sandpit tried in vain to get stronger regulations. Almost 40 years later he says he's "not surprised" the problem re-emerged in Australia.

item.title: A logical gas exports policy could put the economy back on an even keel
item.description: For a decade, a disaster has unfolded. We've run short of gas through indecision and incompetence, and that's driving energy costs and inflation. We need a solution and an unlikely source may have one.

item.title: Domestic violence survivors using strength training for trauma recovery
item.description: In a suburban Canberra gym, no questions are asked. If you identify as a domestic violence survivor, you're in. The WEST Project is an innovative program helping women build themselves back up through powerlifting.

item.title: Wells spends thousands on Comcars to attend grand finals, but has plenty of company
item.description: The sports minister has endured scrutiny over her use of parliamentary expenses, but is one of dozens of MPs to have accumulated large Comcar bills.

item.title: Halfbrick Studios CEO Shainiel Deo on creating the first Bluey video game made in Brisbane
item.description: Halfbrick Studios, the company behind Fruit Ninja, has created the first ever Bluey video game made in Australia.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with European allies as Donald Trump accuses him of not reading US-led peace plan
item.description: European leaders express scepticism about US-led plans to end Russia's invasion, following peace talks between US and Ukrainian officials end without a breakthrough.

item.title: Penny Wong and Richard Marles meet US counterparts in Washington after AUKUS review
item.description: The recommendations made by the US's recent review of the AUKUS pact remain confidential after the talks in Washington, where the two nations have committed to the continued growth of the American military presence in Australia.

item.title: Paramount counters Netflix with hostile bid for Warner Bros Discovery
item.description: The offer paves the way for a battle between Paramount — whose owner, Larry Ellison, is an ally of Donald Trump — and streaming behemoth Netflix to buy one of Hollywood's most storied studios.

item.title: Federal government deal sending non-citizens to Nauru faces critical High Court challenge
item.description: An Iranian man facing removal to Nauru under a controversial agreement will ask the High Court to find the government's plans to deport him lack procedural fairness.

item.title: Some Israeli-backed anti-Hamas gang members surrender to group
item.description: A handful of members of an Israeli-backed anti-Hamas gang in Gaza have surrendered to the militant group, days after their leader was killed in the strip.

item.title: AUKUS project ‘full steam ahead’, US top diplomat says
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Mitch Marsh to retire from Sheffield Shield but leaves door open for Test recall
item.description: Mitch Marsh tells his Western Australia teammates he is retiring, but keeps the door ajar for a Test recall.

item.title: Reserve Bank leaves rates on hold at 3.6pc, Michele Bullock says no more cuts on horizon — as it happened
item.description: The RBA has left the cash rate on hold at 3.6 per cent, as was widely expected by economists. Governor Michele Bullock said the central bank didn't discuss a rate cut at all and instead talked about the need for rate hikes down the track. Here's how the day unfolded on the blog.

item.title: Families left in the lurch after Zone RV caravan manufacturer collapse
item.description: The sensational shutdown of the luxury caravan manufacturer has had a gut-wrenching impact on families from Australia and abroad.

item.title: Telcos call for national register of mobile phones after Triple Zero outages — as it happened
item.description: Telcos and government staffers have been questioned about who knew what and when, after a second Triple Zero failure was linked to a possible death.

item.title: Farmers and innovators say there is potential in Australia's untapped biofuel sector
item.description: Fuels produced from waste and agricultural feedstock are tipped to play a role in cutting emissions, but a leading Victorian farmer says political will is required to seize the opportunity.

item.title: Alex de Minaur wins fourth Newcombe Medal as Maya Joint finishes runner-up
item.description: Alex de Minaur wins the Newcombe Medal for a fourth time, as Cruz Hewitt claims a junior award at Australian tennis's night of nights.

item.title: The Australian Christmas carols that should be on your playlist
item.description: We've rounded up some Australian Christmas carols to enhance your festive mood, from W.G. James to Christine Anu.

item.title: Alter Boy's NRG nominated for WA Music Award for Auslan performances
item.description: Luke Eastman's interpretation work using Auslan in the band Alter Boy is recognised in this year's WA Music Awards, with a nomination for vocalist of the year.

item.title: Search underway at Coffin Bay on SA Eyre Peninsula for man who reportedly fell off jetty
item.description: Emergency services are searching for a man in Coffin Bay on the state's Eyre Peninsula after the alarm was raised about 1am on Tuesday.

item.title: Jakara Anthony, Matt Graham claim FIS moguls gold in Ruka, two months out from Winter Olympics
item.description: Olympic medallists Jakara Anthony and Matt Graham start their FIS World Cup seasons with a bang, claiming double gold in Ruka just two months out from the Milano-Cortina Games.

item.title: As the Cleveland Dodd inquest calls for a 'complete reset' in WA youth detention, what are the next steps?
item.description: The WA government has been sent yet another warning over the death of 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd, who was held in conditions a coroner has compared to "19th century jails". History will show if lessons have been learnt. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

item.title: Jake Weatherald and Ben Stokes caught up in Ashes sledging after Jofra Archer and Steve Smith clash
item.description: Sledging between Jake Weatherald and Ben Stokes emerges after Jofra Archer and Steve Smith's fiery clash at the Gabba.

item.title: WA regional air travel fare cap changes anger residents
item.description: The WA government says it will continue to cap airfares for regional residents but from July next year they will be more expensive during peak holiday periods.

item.title: FIFA announces scheduled water breaks during all games at the 2026 World Cup
item.description: FIFA announces three-minute water breaks in both halves of all games will be included in the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce's defection to One Nation — the view from his electorate
item.description: Voters in the New England electorate share their feelings as they digest the news that local MP Barnaby Joyce has defected from the Nationals to One Nation.

item.title: Mackay riverfront under the microscope as community grapples with addiction and homelessness
item.description: The banks of the Pioneer River near Mackay's CBD are home to makeshift camps nestled among the trees, while others reside in picnic shelters by the wharves.

item.title: Why Kate chose to 'stay flat' after breast cancer surgery
item.description: After a cancer diagnosis, Kate Miller's doctor recommended a mastectomy on one side only. But Kate wanted both breasts gone.

item.title: TPG Telecom boss says second person may have died due to Triple Zero failure
item.description: TPG Telecom chief executive Iñaki Berroeta flags another death possibly linked to a customer's inability to call Triple Zero (000) on their Samsung mobile phone.

item.title: Youths armed with knives and axe during Ellenbrook Secondary College stabbing, court hears
item.description: A gang of youths armed with knives and an axe travelled across Perth to carry out a "premeditated" attack at a Perth high school that left a 15-year-old boy with stab wounds, a court hears.

item.title: Canadian traditional owners fear Australian-style LNG development
item.description: Canadian hereditary chief Na'Moks wanted to find out what a gas pipeline on his land would look like, so he flew to northern Western Australia.

item.title: Inquest into death of tasered 95yo Clare Nowland to focus on dementia training
item.description: A court hears training of aged-care staff and first responders in dealing with people experiencing dementia will be the primary focus of an upcoming inquest.

item.title: Josh Hazlewood ruled out of remainder of the Ashes in injury blow to Australian attack
item.description: Coach Andrew McDonald confirms Josh Hazlewood will not play in the Ashes due to ongoing injuries.

item.title: Travelling teacher Tina Greenfield brings instrumental music to regional schools
item.description: Tina Greenfield drives 350 kilometres each week to teach music to students at five schools in regional Queensland.

item.title: Four dead, one missing after powerful wave drags swimmers out to sea in Tenerife
item.description: Local media reported that a weather advisory for rough seas was in effect when the swimmers were swept out to sea.

item.title: University of Technology Sydney facing crisis amid union-led no-confidence vote in vice-chancellor
item.description: The union-run vote comes as controversial, consultant-designed redundancies continue and politicians call for resignations.

item.title: Toyah Cordingley's murderer Rajwinder Singh sentenced to life in prison for 'violent, brutal' attack
item.description: Rajwinder Singh, 41, was found guilty of the Far North Queensland woman's 2018 murder on a secluded beach north of Cairns. He then fled to India, hiding out for about four years before his arrest and extradition.

item.title: China's trade surplus tops $US1 trillion as exports to Europe, Australia, South-East Asia surge
item.description: China's record trade surplus comes as manufacturers seeking to avoid US President Donald Trump's tariffs ship more to Europe, Australia and South-East Asia.

item.title: Beetaloo Basin gas piped north to 'keep the lights on' in NT from 2026
item.description: The gas-rich Beetaloo Basin in the Northern Territory has been in development for years — now, the NT government says the gas will finally flow from 2026.

item.title: Tameka Yallop waits on scan results that could put Asian Cup campaign in jeopardy
item.description: Matildas stalwart Tameka Yallop's Asian Cup campaign hangs the balance as she awaits news on the hamstring she suffered over the weekend.

item.title: Anthony Albanese delivers eulogy at Graham 'Richo' Richardson's state funeral
item.description: Hundreds of former and current politicians from all sides of the spectrum gathered to remember powerbroker and kingmaker Graham 'Richo' Richardson.

item.title: RBA keeps rates on hold in December at 3.6pc, 'uncomfortable' with inflation at current level
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia keeps rates on hold in December at 3.6 per cent. Governor Michele Bullock says it would be wrong to think the central bank isn't prepared to raise rates.

item.title: Charlie Gander's mother tells Supreme Court hearing about the moment she learnt of his murder
item.description: The mother of murdered Victorian man Charlie Gander has told the Victorian Supreme court that he was an amazing son and brother.

item.title: Online privacy concerns as under-16 social media ban comes into effect
item.description: As the social media ban for under 16s comes into effect, the tech company that is verifying ages for popular messaging app Snapchat says its methods are safe, but cybersecurity experts say any time data is transmitted there's a risk of privacy breaches.

item.title: RFS downgrades Capertee Valley and Milsons Gully fire warnings to Advice
item.description: The NSW Rural Fire Service is asking people at Bogee, near the Capertee National Park, to continue to monitor conditions and follow the advice of emergency services.

item.title: Corrections will change its response to health emergencies, Wayne Hunt inquest hears
item.description: Senior corrections and health staff will change how they respond to health emergencies inside NT jails, following the coronial inquest into the death of a disabled prisoner.

item.title: Man arrested following 'direct and significant' threats to Crows player Izak Rankine
item.description: SA Police have arrested a 31-year-old man after he allegedly sent five threatening messages on social media to a Crows player, who the ABC understands is Izak Rankine.

item.title: Popular Bluey, Paw Patrol toy sets recalled over asbestos fears
item.description: The three "sensory activity sets" from HL Toys International include sealed tubs of coloured sand which Kmart said may contain the toxic mineral.

item.title: Mackay set to host first Test cricket match when Australian men face Bangladesh in 2026
item.description: The Australian men will play a two-match series against Bangladesh in 2026, with the second venue yet to be decided.

item.title: Life-saving blood platelets found to be effective when frozen
item.description: Research proves that frozen blood platelets are safe and effective to use on critically injured patients.

item.title: Patients say pelvic botox injections ease endometriosis pain, but access has been pulled from the ACT public system
item.description: Patients have described the procedure as "life changing" but pelvic botox injections are no longer available publicly in the ACT, with Canberra Health Services ceasing the procedure "as a precaution due to unknown risks".

item.title: Phone calls by criminally neglectful mother showed 'callous disregard' for sick daughter
item.description: A South Australian court releases audio of prison phone calls made in the lead-up to the death of a six-year-old girl in 2022. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the first name and image of a person who has died. Readers are also advised this story contains content which may be distressing.

item.title: Small ways to teach babies and toddlers body safety and consent
item.description: Narrating nappy changes is one way parents and caregivers can strengthen bonds and start lessons around body safety early.

item.title: Bushfire threat for Tasmanian communities in north-east, as Dolphin Sands residents return
item.description: On the same day that residents in one Tasmanian community are returning to find if their homes are still standing after a bushfire last week, residents in north-east coastal towns are being threatened by a new out-of-control blaze.

item.title: Wells initiates audit of expenses as Shorten defends her against 'pile-on'
item.description: The sports minister maintains all her taxpayer-funded expenses have been within the guidelines.

item.title: Mount Gambier woman accused of placing googly eyes on sculpture to begin negotiating with prosecution
item.description: A 20-year-old Mount Gambier woman appears in court in person for the first time, accused of damaging a controversial sculpture, following a campaign to raise money online for her defence.

item.title: Canberra doctor ordered to stop botox injections for endometriosis pain
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: People have been filmed swimming with sharks at Byron Bay.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Byron Bay shark frenzy attracts onlookers and a warning to steer clear
item.description: A marine scientist warns against getting in the ocean with sharks after footage emerges of swimmers at Byron Bay next to a huge school of bait fish and hundreds of the predators.

item.title: Trump laments he 'can't appoint anybody' as handpicked prosecutor Alina Habba quits unlawful tenure
item.description: US President Donald Trump has expressed frustration over his judicial nominations getting blocked as the lawyer he hand-picked as New Jersey's top federal prosecutor, Alina Habba, quits.

item.title: Union calls on SA government to reach urgent pay agreement to end prison lockdown
item.description: Advocates for prisoners and the union representing correctional officers are calling on the government to reach an urgent pay agreement to help end the statewide prison lockdown.

item.title: Woodford Folk Festival founder Bill Hauritz dies at 73
item.description: Woodford Folk Festival founder Bill Hauritz has died after a lengthy illness, but his grieving loved ones say his legacy will live on.

item.title: England quick Mark Wood to fly home after being ruled out of final Ashes Tests
item.description: England's Ashes woes have continue with spearhead quick Mark Wood ruled out of the rest of the tour with a knee injury.

item.title: Canberra doctor ordered to stop botox injections for endometriosis pain
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: City of Moreton Bay tells court homeless camps it destroyed were not 'homes'
item.description: The City of Moreton Bay council has told the Supreme Court that homeless tents it destroyed were not "homes" and the human right to a home was not violated.

item.title: Prosecution tells jury a jailhouse confession proves Jodie Hill was involved in alleged murder
item.description: The prosecution has begun its closing arguments in the final stages of Jodie Hill's three week murder trial following the brutal killing of an elderly man in his Dimboola home almost three years ago.

item.title: Woman who fatally struck 12yo boy with car outside Tasmanian high school avoids prison
item.description: The family of a 12-year-old boy fatally struck by a car as he left school criticises the sentence handed down to the driver.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: More crocodiles to be targeted for removal under expansion of Queensland management plan
item.description: The government says the plan will help improve public safety and make it easier to remove crocodiles in hotspots along the coast.

item.title: Honduras seeks international arrest of ex-president Hernández after Donald Trump pardon
item.description: Juan Orlando Hernández had been sentenced in US federal court last year to 45 years in prison for helping move tons of cocaine to the United States.

item.title: Linda Reynolds will fight Commonwealth government 'until the bitter end' in lawsuit related to Brittany Higgins
item.description: Former defence minister Linda Reynolds says Coalition colleagues failed her and that she won't stop fighting to clear her name against "lies", no matter the cost.

item.title: Inquest wraps up into death of Perth 10yo boy in Department of Communities care
item.description: The inquest into the boy's death in state care hears he was a bright and mischievous boy who was proud of his heritage. WARNING: This story contains distressing content.

item.title: Fire breaks out in office building in Indonesia's capital Jakarta, killing at least 22 people
item.description: The fire broke out on the first floor of an office building in Indonesia's capital around midday on Tuesday, with at least 100 firefighters deployed to contain the blaze.

item.title: Ukraine to send US revised peace plan as Volodymyr Zelenskyy rules out ceding territory
item.description: Donald Trump's initial proposal to end the war was judged by Ukraine's allies to be overly favourable to Russia.

item.title: Donald Trump criticises 'weak' leaders of 'decaying' Europe and hints he could stop backing Ukraine
item.description: The US president has hinted he could walk away from supporting Ukraine and suggested it could cede territory to Moscow, as "Russia has the upper hand".

item.title: Thailand-Cambodia border clashes spread, forcing tens of thousands of civilians to flee
item.description: More than 140,000 civilians have been evacuated from border regions since fresh fighting between Thailand and Cambodia began on Sunday, officials said.

item.title: Techno Park residents win zoning battle to remain in Williamstown affordable housing estate
item.description: Residents of a former migrant hostel have won the right to keep living in their homes, years after they were first threatened with eviction because of a zoning issue.

item.title: Today in History, December 10: How Lord of the Rings changed cinema — and New Zealand
item.description: Peter Jackson's life wouldn't be the same after that red carpet event on December 10, 2001, but it's fair to say cinema, and New Zealand, wouldn't be the same either.

item.title: Borders quiz: How well do you know Australian geography?
item.description: Which state has the longest land border? Test your knowledge in today's quiz.

item.title: Interest rate rises replace cuts on Michele Bullock's RBA agenda
item.description: The Reserve Bank governor has opened the door to interest rate hikes in 2026, but how soon will she walk through it?

item.title: Australia's social media ban for under-16s starts today. Here is what you should know
item.description: After months of build-up, the time has finally come. From today, Australians under the age of 16 are now banned from having a social media account.

item.title: Australian man Lamar Ahchee accused of smuggling cocaine in Bali tells court he was 'coerced'
item.description: Lamar Ahchee was arrested in Bali in May after Indonesian police tracked the delivery of two packages containing cocaine to his apartment.

item.title: Penalties push for financial abusers who draw partners into tax and company fraud
item.description: Perpetrators of financial abuse commit fraud by impersonating their partners, making them company directors in secret and putting business and tax debts in their names. The government wants to fix the problem, but will its proposed reforms go far enough?

item.title: Demand for water cannot be an 'afterthought' in AI push
item.description: Australia has more than 250 data centres and more in the pipeline, prompting experts to warn against using drinking water to cool servers.

item.title: AEMO slashes forecasts for wind farms as falling costs fuel solar, batteries
item.description: Soaring costs and trenchant criticism from some put the brakes on wind and transmission as the sun shines on big solar and batteries.

item.title: Federal politicians charge taxpayers $1.1 million for family travel in 12 months
item.description: Family reunion travel is under scrutiny as new analysis shows federal MPs and senators spent $1.1 million on flying and driving their loved ones to Canberra and around Australia in 12 months.

item.title: The best albums of 2025 from Lorde, Tame Impala, FKA twigs and more
item.description: It's been an incredible year of music. Did your favourite album of 2025 make our list?

item.title: Rare dinosaur skeleton exhibit going under hammer at Christie's in London
item.description: An ultra-rare dinosaur skeleton is being auctioned in London this week, sparking debate about the ethics of selling specimens with scientific value.

item.title: ABC 2026 Heywire winners bring 'raw, honest storytelling' of life in regional Australia
item.description: Thirty-five young people have been named 2026 ABC Heywire winners for the bravery and authenticity of their life stories.

item.title: Community comes together to send Christmas cards to South Australian prisoners
item.description: Two Adelaide women have made it their mission to collect 2,000 Christmas cards for prisoners who'll spend this year's festive season behind bars.
